p.s: With the iambic parameter, Shakespeare wants to underline the theme love, because the iambic parameter has the rhytmrhythm of the heartbeat.
Also conspicuous is that on every question mark follows a O or Or.
This supports the feeling of misunderstanding, why the adresseeaddressee does not take action in the real life.
The repeating of O in the whole sonnet and the repeating of Or at the beginning of line 11 and 12 are also anaphoras.
Also conspicicuousconspicuous is that exceptingexcept from the last verse no dots are used.
There are only question marks at the end of each sentence, which underlines, how doubtful it is that the adresseeaddressee does not speak his love out.
Only in the final couplet is a full dot and not question mark, because the final couplet is the answer on the many questions.
With the many questions Shakespeare influences the reader to ask himself things and overthink the whole poem.
The repitition nor stone, nor earth, nor boundless sea [...] in the first line, shows how strong his love is.
Boundless sea is also a metaphor.
The question How [...] whose action is no stronger than a flower?, underlines that the adresseeaddressee doesn't take action, because flowers are not strong.
This is a big paradox, but a symbol at the same time, because flowers are a symbol of love.
The repitition of time's in the 10.
line supports the problem of the running time, because time is not endless.
With using this repetition, Shakespeare makes clear that the adresseeaddressee must take actions until it is too late.
The answer on that is the paradoxonparadox [...] that in black ink my love may still shine bright in the last verse, because black ink cannot shine bright.
So the adresseeaddressee can also maybe not take action on his love.
In the context of Shakespeare's catalogue of sonnets, the addressee of this sonnet is a young man, which has a problem with his strong love.
Sonnet 65 shows, that the young man in fact has the love inside him, but to make the love true, he must speak it out and take action.
So the message of the sonnet is that people must take action and speak out their love.
He underlines this with the factors of time and death.
This creates the feeling to make decisions fast until it is too late.
